item.title: Following earthquake in Haiti, radio smateurs asked to keep frequencies clear
item.description: In a statement received by ARRL on August 14, 2021, Region 2 of the International Amateur Radio Union (IARU-R2) has requested that radio amateurs in the Americas keep the following frequencies clear to support emergency communications in Haiti following an earthquake this morning: 3750 kHz, 7150 kHz and 14330 kHz

item.title: Strong support for ILLW 2021
item.description: Despite the global effect of the Covid pandemic, the ILLW is going ahead next weekend with strong support from the amateur fraternity from 42 countries

item.title: The search for Flight MH370
item.description: John Willliam VK4JJW has an update on how WSPR, the Weak Signal Propagation Reporting remains a key source of hope in the search for the wreckage of the missing airliner

item.title: Icelandic WEB-SDR
item.description: The Icelandic Radio Club reports that Ari (TF1A) installed a new web-based Kiwi-SDR receiver, owned and operated by (TF3GZ), and that it has gone online in Iceland, at Bláfjöll Mountain, at an elevation of 690 meters.
